overview_of_class:
Goals of the course
? Understand regulations governing research with human subjects; be CITI certified
? Identify a topic of interest to you in music cognition
? Design a study on the topic and implement it (stimuli, presentation, data collection)
? Obtain IRB approval for the study
? As time permits, collect pilot data and analyze this data

Structure of the course
Week 1: Introduction; CITI training (or review for those already certified)
Week 2: Topic identification and first survey of the literature; classic experiments
Week 3: Behavioral methods overview: Quantitative and qualitative
Weeks 4-5: Study design and IRB submission
Weeks 6-8: Implementation of the study (stimuli, presentation, programming?)
Weeks 9-10: Initial data collection and analysis

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Grades and evaluation
This is a hands-on class; your work involves getting trained and approved for human research, identifying, researching, and designing a project on a topic of your choice, and getting pilot data. Your grade will be based on your ongoing work, class participation, and a 10-page (minimum) final project encompassing the background/design/methods (and results if possible) sections of a research article. Since so much of the grade depends on your progress, please keep up with the work at all times. Please note that without active participation in class discussions the highest grade possible is a B+.
Grades will be given on the following basis:
Ongoing work, daily project reports 60%
Final project 30%
Class participation. 10%
Total 100%

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: The primary use of texts in this course is to help you identify a music-cognitive topic of interest to you, become familiar with the prior literature on that topic, and design an experiment of your own. A single-volume reference work in music cognition will probably be of great value to most students; The Oxford Handbook of Music Psychology (Hallam, Cross, & Thaut, eds.) is recommended for this purpose.
